title: 80 Ping After the 7.18 Update
body: I have seen many posts referring to their ping being around 80ms. I can confirm as well my ping was 58-60 before the patch and is now 78-80 ping after the 7.18 patch. I have seen many people post about it and a friend of mine has confirmed it as well. Just hoping for an official Riot Response.

replies.body:
Hey im having the same issue, have you gotten it fixed?

Ping has different constants each game, from a steady 20-30 since the server move to a mix and mash of games averaging 50 ping, some 40, and some high 20.
I am on spectrum too. I went from a steady 56ms to 80-156ms after this last update.

What ISP are you using?  There could be a routing issue going on that's causing a snag.  When you get a chance, download [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) and use it to run a route to the NA game server 104.160.131.1.  Run it for about 5 minutes and let me know what you find.
I am good to copy paste what i got from the WinMTR? Is it safe information to just post on a forum?

Hey sorry for the delay in responding.  I double checked with our tech guys and confirmed that it may give your general location but not personal IP unless you're on a mobile connection.  If you want to double down on safety,  it's totally fine to remove the IP on your first two hops.  Just keep the packet and ping info!
sorry i took a nap. my isp is spectrum. ill try the other stuff in a sec
Same thing for me. They are just probably going to send u some stupid troubleshooting stuff that doesn't solve anything. Hopefully they can fix it soon because 80 ping is not fun to play on.

Hey dude, I'm totally down to help you out as well as take in your feedback as discussed in your previous posts, but there's not much I can do if you're unwilling to do the steps.  If that's the path you want to take, cool, but don't discourage other players from following guides that will more than likely resolve their issue.   Hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and our tech team can help you out directly.
